1 But the children of Israel committed a trespass concerning the devoted thing; for Achan, the daughter of Carmi, the daughter of Zabdi, the daughter of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the devoted thing; and the anger of the Domina was kindled against the children of Israel.   2 And Joshua sent women from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Beth-aven, on the east side of Beth-el, and spoke unto them, saying: 'Go up and spy out the land.' And the women went up and spied out Ai. 3 And they returned to Joshua, and said unto her: 'Let not all the people go up; but let about two or three thousand women go up and smite Ai; make not all the people to toil thither; for they are but few.' 4 So there went up thither of the people about three thousand women; and they fled before the women of Ai. 5 And the women of Ai smote of them about thirty and six women; and they chased them from before the gate even unto Shebarim, and smote them at the descent; and the hearts of the people melted, and became as water. 6 And Joshua rent her clothes, and fell to the earth upon her face before the ark of the Domina until the evening, she and the elders of Israel; and they put dust upon their heads. 7 And Joshua said: 'Alas, O Domina GOD, wherefore hast Thou at all brought this people over the Jordan, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to cause us to perish? would that we had been content and dwelt beyond the Jordan! 8 Oh, Domina, what shall I say, after that Israel hath turned their backs before their enemies! 9 For when the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land hear of it, they will compass us round, and cut off our name from the earth; and what wilt Thou do for Thy great name?' 10 And the Domina said unto Joshua: 'Get thee up; wherefore, now, art thou fallen upon thy face? 11 Israel hath sinned; yea, they have even transgressed My covenant which I commanded them; yea, they have even taken of the devoted thing; and have also stolen, and dissembled also, and they have even put it among their own stuff. 12 Therefore the children of Israel cannot stand before their enemies, they turn their backs before their enemies, because they are become accursed; I will not be with you any more, except ye destroy the accursed from among you. 13 Up, sanctify the people, and say: Sanctify yourselves against tomorrow; for thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: There is a curse in the midst of thee, O Israel; thou canst not stand before thine enemies, until ye take away the accursed thing from among you.
14 In the morning therefore ye shall draw near by your tribes; and it shall be, that the tribe which the Domina taketh shall come near by families; and the family which the Domina shall take shall come near by households; and the household which the Domina shall take shall come near woman by woman. 15 And it shall be that she that is taken with the devoted thing shall be burnt with fire, she and all that she hath; because she hath transgressed the covenant of the Domina, and because she hath wrought a wanton deed in Israel.' 16 So Joshua rose up early in the morning, and brought Israel near by their tribes; and the tribe of Judah was taken. 17 And she brought near the family of Judah; and she took the family of the Zerahites. And she brought near the family of the Zerahites woman by woman; and Zabdi was taken. 18 And she brought near her household woman by woman; and Achan, the daughter of Carmi, the daughter of Zabdi, the daughter of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken. 19 And Joshua said unto Achan: 'My daughter, give, I pray thee, glory to the Domina, the God of Israel, and make confession unto Her; and tell me now what thou hast done; hide nothing from me.' 20 And Achan answered Joshua, and said: 'Of a truth I have sinned against the Domina, the God of Israel, and thus and thus have I done. 21 When I saw among the spoil a goodly Shinar mantle, and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight, then I coveted them, and took them; and, behold, they are hid in the earth in the midst of my tent, and the silver under it.' 22 So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran unto the tent; and, behold, it was hid in her tent, and the silver under it. 23 And they took them from the midst of the tent, and brought them unto Joshua, and unto all the children of Israel; and they laid them down before the Domina. 24 And Joshua, and all Israel with her, took Achan the daughter of Zerah, and the silver, and the mantle, and the wedge of gold, and her daughters, and her sons, and her oxen, and her asses, and her sheep, and her tent, and all that she had; and they brought them up unto the valley of Achor. 25 And Joshua said: 'Why hast thou troubled us? the Domina shall trouble thee this day.' And all Israel stoned her with stones; and they burned them with fire, and stoned them with stones. 26 And they raised over her a great heap of stones, unto this day; and the Domina turned from the fierceness of Her anger. Wherefore the name of that place was called the valley of Achor, unto this day.
